p:
Dysregulation of CDKs-cyclin pathway resulting in uncontrolled proliferation have been observed in various cancers
20–22 . Owing to the important role of CDKs in the control of cell division, numerous drugs targeting CDKs were designed and reported in the clinic
23 . Several selective CDK4/6 inhibitors have been reported in the recent years. Pfizer’s palbociclib represents the first CDK inhibitor approved by the US FDA in February 2015 to treat HR+/HER2-breast cancer
24
,
25 . Novartis’ ribociclib and Lilly’s abemaciclib also got a fast approval by FDA in March 2017 and September 2017, respectively, to treat HR+/HER2-breast cancer
26
,
27 . While as reported, both palbociclib and ribociclib as selective CDK4/6 inhibitors need to combine with letrozole for the treatment of breast cancer
28
,
29 . Abemaciclib with additional kinase activities, such as CDK1, CDK2 and CDK9 shows unique single-agent activities
30
,
31 . These studies indicate that monotherapy targeting of individual cell cycle CDKs may be insufficient for cancer therapy.
